Compute Cover values of your model for reference dataset other than the original set used to train model.

Source: R/recalculate_covers.R
recalculate_covers.Rd

Compute Cover values of your model for reference dataset other than the original set used to train model.

recalculate_covers(model, X)

Arguments

model

Unified dataframe representation of the model created with a (model).unify function.
X

Reference dataset. A dataframe with the same columns as in the training set of the model.

Value

Unified dataframe representation of the model as created with a (model).unify function, but with Cover column containing updated values.

See also

xgboost.unify for XGBoost models

lightgbm.unify for LightGBM models

catboost.unify for Catboost models

Examples

# \dontrun{
library(gbm)
data <- fifa20$data[colnames(fifa20$data) != 'work_rate']
data['value_eur'] <- fifa20$target
gbm_model <- gbm::gbm(
             formula = value_eur ~ .,
             data = data,
             distribution = "laplace",
             n.trees = 1000,
             cv.folds = 2,
             interaction.depth = 2,
             n.cores = 1)

#> CV: 1 
#> CV: 2 
unified <- gbm.unify(gbm_model)
recalculate_covers(unified, data[200:700, ])

#>       Tree Node   Feature Split Yes No Missing Quality/Score Cover
#>    1:    0    0   overall  65.5   2  3       7    5448.11127   501
#>    2:    0    1      <NA>    NA  NA NA      NA  -37500.00000     0
#>    3:    0    2 potential  68.5   4  5       6     993.25693   501
#>    4:    0    3      <NA>    NA  NA NA      NA   -7500.00000     0
#>    5:    0    4      <NA>    NA  NA NA      NA  170000.00000   501
#>   ---                                                             
#> 6996:  999    2      <NA>    NA  NA NA      NA     -50.60841     0
#> 6997:  999    3      <NA>    NA  NA NA      NA     350.72964     0
#> 6998:  999    4      <NA>    NA  NA NA      NA     232.18627     0
#> 6999:  999    5      <NA>    NA  NA NA      NA     -55.00373   501
#> 7000:  999    6      <NA>    NA  NA NA      NA     -21.06509     0
# }
